raw_mentions:
Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

An antibody that “specifically binds to” or is “specific for” a particular polypeptide or an epitope on a particular polypeptide is one that binds to that particular polypeptide or epitope on a particular polypeptide without substantially binding to any other polypeptide or polypeptide epitope. For example, the Coronavirus S protein specific antibodies of the present invention are specific to Coronavirus S protein. In some embodiments, the antibody that binds to Coronavirus S protein has a dissociation constant (Kd) of £100 nM, £10 nM, £1 nM, £0.1 nM, £0.01 nM, or £0.001 nM (e.g., 10<sup>-8</sup>M or less, e.g., from 10<sup>_8</sup>M to 10<sup>-13</sup>M, e.g., from 10<sup>-9</sup>M to 10<sup>-13</sup> M). 

Note that there is only one sentence that meets the criteria, but it is a bit long and contains multiple values for the dissociation constant (Kd). If you would like, I can break it down into separate sentences, each with a specific value for Kd:

In some embodiments, the antibody that binds to Coronavirus S protein has a dissociation constant (Kd) of £100 nM.
In some embodiments, the antibody that binds to Coronavirus S protein has a dissociation constant (Kd) of £10 nM.
In some embodiments, the antibody that binds to Coronavirus S protein has a dissociation constant (Kd) of £1 nM.
In some embodiments, the antibody that binds to Coronavirus S protein has a dissociation constant (Kd) of £0.1 nM.
In some embodiments, the antibody that binds to Coronavirus S protein has a dissociation constant (Kd) of £0.01 nM.
In some embodiments, the antibody that binds to Coronavirus S protein has a dissociation constant (Kd) of £0.001 nM.

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

The binding affinity of Fab22 to MERS-CoV S was comparable to those of SARS-CoV S and SARS-CoV-2 S, with KD values of 2.9 nM, 7.2 nM, and 6.7 nM, respectively (FIGS. 5A-C).
IgG22 and IgG72 exhibited potent neutralizing activity, with IC50 values of 0.12 pg/mL and 2.45 pg/mL, respectively (FIG. 5D).
